articles.title: Russia fires on and seizes Ukrainian vessels
articles.description: Ukraine’s president calls for martial law in response
articles.content: IN DIPLOMACY, building bridges is usually a good thing. But Russias Crimean Bridge, spanning the Kerch Strait between the Sea of Azov and the Black Sea (see map), has been more flashpoint than pacifier since it opened six months ago. On November 25th Russian … [+3714 chars]

articles.title: An alleged chemical attack by rebels threatens a truce in Syria
articles.description: Rebels holed up in Idlib fear Russia and the Assad regime will try to take the province
articles.content: FOR MUCH OF the summer it seemed that a Russian-backed assault on Idlib province, the Syrian rebels last redoubt, was imminent. International observers feared it would be an especially bloody battle, leading to a humanitarian crisis. But diplomacy prevailed i… [+2514 chars]

articles.title: How markets can turn against the unsuspecting (2015)
articles.description: Two heavyweights show how markets can turn against the unsuspecting
articles.content: Phishing for Phools: The Economics of Manipulation and Deception. By George Akerlof and Robert Shiller. Princeton University Press; 272 pages; $24.95, £16.95. COMPETITIVE markets by their very nature spawn deception and trickery. This is not the hyperbole of … [+3649 chars]

articles.title: Britain agrees exit terms with the EU. Now for Parliament to decide
articles.description: Winning support in Westminster will be harder than in Brussels
